title: What helps us to adapt and cope with the environment? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because the climate is chaotic and unpredictable there will always be major environmental damage from hurricanes, tornados, floods and snow storms etc,. Fossil fuels are essential to help us cope with severe weather. There is no alternative now or in the future. Diesel engines save many lives with alternative power when the electricity grid goes down. Major equipment is necessary to repair levies after flood damage. Air rescue is entirely based on fossil fuel engines etc.  ORLAND, UNITED KINGDOM - FEBRUARY 10: Heavy duty mobile water pumps and piping from the Netherlands arrives in the village of Moorland as flood water continues to cut off villages on the Somerset Levels on February 10, 2014 in Moorland, England. Thousands of acres of the Somerset Levels have been under water for weeks, yet flood levels are still rising and worryingly, more rain is forecast for later this week. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty  BURROWBRIDGE, UNITED KINGDOM - FEBRUARY 10: Millions of gallons of water are pumped from flooded land surrounding the village of Burrowbridge on the Somerset Levels on February 10, 2014 in Moorland, England. Thousands of acres of the Somerset Levels have been under water for weeks, yet flood levels are still rising and worryingly, more rain is forecast for later this week. (Photo by Matt Cardy/Getty Images) Wind and solar are helpless in environmental crisis.

The environment is adapting to us because of carbon emission, over population and greed but the impact is on the worse side. For humans it is evolution. We will learn to adapt with sudden climate change, drought or excessive rainfall, summers may become hotter and winter colder. We may find snowing in areas not heard of, less drinking water, food shortages. Our body will gradually adapt to these changes.
